discussion.content: States that it is "based on host system". That's the tell for a container, and maybe even a chroot jail, but the jail uses the hosts' libraries

questions.question_text:
A systems administrator wants to deploy several applications to the same server quickly. Each application should be abstracted from the host with its own dependencies and libraries and utilize a minimal footprint.
Which of the following would be BEST in this scenario?

choices.D: iwconfig wlan0 display, iwconfig wlan0 essid=ג€labג€

questions.question_text:
A network administrator requested a change in workstation routing to a new access point.
Which of the following will display the current settings for wlan0 and set the new access point name to lab?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Here's the format:
# to display interface details
iwconfig wlan0 
# to rename interface essid
iwconfig wlan0 essid lab

The closest answer is 'B.'

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a file that can define how to build deploy, and install various components for a Linux application hosted in a cloud environment?
questions.answer_description: File that can define how to build deploy, and install various components for a Linux application hosted in a cloud environment

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The supplied link states, "13. git branch [branch name] / git branch -d [branch name] → Git branches allow users to create several different work areas within the same repo. In a professional environment, it is very common to create a new branch whenever you wish to make several changes to a project or to fix a bug, and then merge that branch back into the master branch when we’re done."

questions.question_text: An administrator clones a Git repository onto a local laptop. While inspecting the code, the administrator notices a bug and wants to fix it. Which of the following is the BEST command for the administrator to use to test a patch for the script prior to updating the version saved in master?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A, C, and D all contain an 'x' switch with tar command.

Selected Answer: B
From man
 -x, --extract, --get
 extract files from an archive
